newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Prodi to attend ceremony for U.N. dead.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Prodi to attend ceremony for U.N. dead.

text.p: Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi will travel to Israel on Thursday to attend a military ceremony for the five U.N. peacekeeping troops who died in a helicopter crash in southern Lebanon, his office said.
The service for the four Italians and one Irish soldier who died in Wednesday's crash was due to be held in the Israeli capital Tel Aviv later in the day.
United Nations investigators were trying on Thursday to determine the cause of the crash, which occurred in the Bint Jbeil area inside Israel's occupation zone in south Lebanon.

The dead were part of the U.N. Interim Force in Lebanon (UNIFIL), which was established in 1978 to restore the Lebanese government's authority over the southern part of the country after Israel had invaded to drive out Palestinian guerrillas.

When Israel withdrew most troops following a subsequent 1982 invasion, it retained a "security zone" along the Lebanese side of the border, aided by its allies of the South Lebanon Army militia, to block attacks against northern Israel.
